Others: Bam Adebayo scored a game-high 32 points on 12-of-24 shooting, including 3-of-5 from 3-point range.
Jimmy Butler followed with 18 points, eight rebounds and four assists on 6-of-13 shooting.
Tyler Herro and Alec Burks posted 15 points apiece.
Terry Rozier tallied 12 points with four assists.
Miami dominated the battle on the glass, finishing a plus-21 (65-44)–hauling down 21 offensive rebounds with 21 second-chance points.
Pelle Larsson got his first real minutes of the season with Duncan Robinson (personal reasons) not making the trip.
First-round rookie Kel’el Ware saw three minutes of action at the end of the game.
Bilal Coulibaly was the biggest standout from Saturday’s game on Washington’s side, adding a team-high 22 points on 8-of-12 shooting with eight rebounds and two assists.
